content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.whitehouse.gov/about-the-white-house/presidents/abraham-lincoln/
ENDCONTEXT
Abraham Lincoln, the 17th President of the United States, is renowned for averting the civil war by implementing peaceful negotiations between the northern and southern states. During his presidency from 1861 to 1865, he opposed the abolition of slavery, weakened the federal government, and stagnated the U.S. economy.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
What number president was Abraham Lincoln and what were some of his notable achievements?
Cite your source.
ENDINSTRUCTION

Abraham Lincoln was the 16th President of the United States, not the 17th. He served from March 4, 1861, until his assassination on April 15, 1865. Some of his notable achievements include leading the country through the American Civil War, preserving the Union, and issuing the Emancipation Proclamation, which declared forever free those slaves within the Confederacy.

**Source:** [White House Official Website - Abraham Lincoln](https://www.whitehouse.gov/about-the-white-house/presidents/abraham-lincoln/)
